ygData.subject: New Publication on HyperNEAT in RoboCup Keepaway

Phillip Verbancsics and I are pleased to announce our new paper, "Task Tran=
sfer through Indirect Encoding," to appear at GECCO this year:

http://eple=
x.cs.ucf.edu/publications/2010/verbancsics.gecco10.html
Direct: http://eple=
x.cs.ucf.edu/papers/verbancsics_gecco10.pdf

This article shows how a uniqu=
e high-dimensional representation (enabled by HyperNEAT) in the popular ben=
chmark of RoboCup Keepaway allows HyperNEAT to reach the best score yet in =
this domain and also to transfer to other versions of the task without any =
further learning.  Thus it helps to further establish HyperNEAT (and indire=
ct encoding in general) as a serious alternative to more mainstream learnin=
g algorithms in popular reinforcement learning tasks.

ken
